instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: conected with WiFi but no Internet
threads.message:
Hello, I have a problem I dont know what could that be.

I replaced a mainboard from a macbook air, everything is working well, only internet is aproblem.
I can see the WiFi names, I can conect to WiFi
I see my IP, DNS all isok, but safari dont let me in the internet. the same external drive is working perfect on another macbook with the same network

I replaced the wifi card but same problem. did anybody had a probplem in this way already?

please help Im going crazy on this

threads.title: conected with WiFi but no Internet
threads.message: Did you set the correct time/day?

threads.title: conected with WiFi but no Internet
threads.message:
yes. and he set automaticly the time over internet. 
firewall is off. same hdd on other macbook is all ok

threads.title: conected with WiFi but no Internet
threads.message: IP4 is configured DHCP, just i toke a look and the ip and mask  is a random, after click renew DCHP lease it got the "right" ip and mask. but all still the same no internet in any explorer, nothing in dropbox

threads.title: conected with WiFi but no Internet
threads.message: Connect wifi antennas from another case.

threads.title: conected with WiFi but no Internet
threads.message: oh, good idea. that is working proper good. so i guess a bad wifi antena conector. I will try to solder the antenna directly to the wifi card

threads.title: conected with WiFi but no Internet
threads.message:
Probably end pipe screw fucked the antenna cable.
I never put back that screw again; passed to me one time...

threads.title: conected with WiFi but no Internet
threads.message:
thanks so much for your quick help. thats it! under microscope I found what you thought. end pipe screw damaged wifi cable. I hate this screw too and I am all the time carefull, but now I am srewed as well. in futer I dont will put back that screw as well. thanks.

[SOLVED]
